poem:
The Black Beast  

Outside the cinema,  
a monstrous bus—  
jet black shell,  
shielded windows;  
secrets held,  
a nomad's cloak.  

Inside, blindfolded,  
lost players;  
unseen streets,  
echoes of guesswork.  

East London watches,  
and the bus rolls on—  
a riddle on wheels,  
unfolding with every turn.
